name: Frank Emilio Flynn
description: '''Francisco Emilio Flynn Rodríguez''' (April 13, 1921 – August 23, 2001), better known as '''Frank Emilio Flynn''', was a renowned Cuban pianist. Despite being blind, he was a skilled and versatile pianist who mastered many forms of Cuban music, from [[contradanza|danzas]] and [[danzón|danzones]] to [[Filin (music)|filin]], [[descarga]] and [[Afro-Cuban jazz]]. He was the founder and director of several ensembles, including Loquibambia (1946) and Los Modernistas (1951), both co-founded with [[José Antonio Méndez]], as well as the Quinteto Instrumental de Música Moderna (1958), which later became Los Amigos.
